page.title: 02Ludgershall
page.content: Ludgeshall. The historic centre of the village, a conservation area, contains a number of old cottages, a fine church (St James), and on its northern limit the ruins of the once area, including a new superarket! the village has gown out from this centre along the Andover road, eventually creeping out to Faberstown, its eastern limit. Most new development, has been to the north of the Andover road towards Crawlboys Lane, a more recently on land adjoining the old railway line to the south of the existing settlement. There are various community facilities,a health centre, sports centre, and one Junior and one Secondary school.
